headline: The Shape of What We _______ to Hear
description: A four-part philosophical and ethical exploration of consumption, animal intelligence, symbolic grief, and cephalopod cognition. This post connects the deep sea to the dinner table, questioning what it means to listen — and what we ignore.
resonantThread: what signals mean when we pretend they don’t
whyItMatters: This piece weaves ethics, evolution, and signal theory into a single chord. It insists that our discomfort is the signal, not the error — and that even silence might carry meaning, if we’re willing to hear it.
articleExcerpt:
Title: The Shape of What We _______ to Hear

History will judge the eating of animals from factory farms as we now judge those who practiced slavery, human sacrifice, genocide...
sourceFragments: Cows don’t fly planes and pigs can’t scuba dive isn’t a valid logic tree.
How would we know if bark is referential? Dogs remember people.
That shimmer is not symbolic. Because it’s not 'learned.' Why be insistent on barring meaning?
We’re building a new caste of expendable minds. Bugs? Maybe.
That was the real moment: when a squid turned, not ran, not tested, or even fully see me—*looked.*
